emerging_technologies.name: Smart Contract Ecosystem
emerging_technologies.description: An ecosystem of smart contracts that automatically execute, control, or document legally relevant events according to the terms of a contract or agreement.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Increases trust in digital transactions but raises concerns about legal and privacy issues.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on regulatory acceptance, standardization, and overcoming scalability challenges.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Dust
emerging_technologies.description: Miniature sensors that can be implanted into the brain to monitor and possibly control neural activity.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Offers potential for advanced medical treatments but poses ethical questions about privacy and autonomy.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption hinges on overcoming technical barriers in biocompatibility and regulatory approval.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Infrastructure Repair Drones
emerging_technologies.description: Drones equipped with AI to automatically detect, diagnose, and repair infrastructure damage.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces human risk in hazardous work environments but could lead to job displacement in maintenance sectors.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires advancements in drone technology, AI decision-making, and public trust in autonomous systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Genomic Personalized Medicine
emerging_technologies.description: Tailored medical treatments based on an individual's genetic profile.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances treatment efficacy and could reduce healthcare costs but raises issues of genetic discrimination.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on cost reduction, ethical guidelines, and integration into existing healthcare systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Space-Based Solar Power
emerging_technologies.description: Satellites that capture solar energy in space and beam it back to Earth as microwaves or lasers.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could provide constant clean energy but requires significant initial investment and international cooperation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on technological breakthroughs in energy transmission and space infrastructure.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Powered Medical Diagnostics
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that analyze medical imagery and patient data to assist or even automate diagnosis.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in advanced healthcare systems, with ongoing integration into less developed regions.

mainstream_technologies.name: Urban Autonomous Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Self-driving cars designed for urban environments, focusing on safety, efficiency, and reduced emissions.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in major cities, with regulatory frameworks evolving to support their integration.

epoch_themes.description: Enhancing security, privacy, and trust in digital transactions and interactions.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Reduces fraud, increases digital economy participation, but requires new legal frameworks.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing demand for secure and transparent digital systems, driven by growth in online transactions and IoT.

epoch_themes.description: Leveraging technology for creating eco-friendly and efficient urban environments.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Improves urban living conditions, reduces environmental impact, but might lead to urban-rural divides.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Urbanization, climate change mitigation, and smart city initiatives drive this theme.
